turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Hey, Google. Order me a coffee from Starbucks.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Ok. Which Starbucks did you want me to order from?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: The one near work. No, actually, are there any downtown?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: I’ll check. Yes, there are two. One on Main Street and one on Third.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Third and what?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Third and Melrose.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Is that near the post office?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Yes, just south of the post office.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: The one on Third, then.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: What drink did you want me to order?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: A soy cappuccino.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Did you want a single or double shot?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Make it a double.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: And what size did you want?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Large.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Do you mean Grande?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Yeah, Grande.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Ok, I’ll order you a Grande double soy Cappuccino from the Starbucks at 1345 Third Street, downtown.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Thanks Google.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Do you want me to confirm the order when you are en route?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: No, that’s ok.
